5.4 Hyper-parameter Tuning

In order to tune the process noise covariance QksuperscriptùëÑùëòQ^{k}italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT we rely on heuristics and qualitative observations. Empirical results on the FJ model suggests that the sensitivity matrix is non-negative. This leads to the condition ‚Ñìk+wk‚â•0n2,‚àÄk‚àà‚Ñï0formulae-sequencesuperscript‚Ñìùëòsuperscriptùë§ùëòsubscript0superscriptùëõ2for-allùëòsubscript‚Ñï0\ell^{k}+w^{k}\geq 0_{n^{2}},\forall k\in\mathbb{N}_{0}roman_‚Ñì start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚â• 0 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ‚àÄ italic_k ‚àà blackboard_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT in the random walk (10). Therefore, to ensure a non-negative sensitivity, it is required to have the condition ‚à•wk‚à•‚àû‚â§min‚Å¢{‚Ñìk}subscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•superscriptùë§ùëòminsuperscript‚Ñìùëò\lVert w^{k}\rVert_{\infty}\leq\mathrm{min}\{\ell^{k}\}‚à• italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àû end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ roman_min { roman_‚Ñì start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT }. This condition is satisfied by choosing an MùëÄMitalic_M large enough such that

œÉqk=mini:‚Ñì^ik‚â†0‚Å¢‚Ñì^ik/M.superscriptsubscriptùúéùëûùëò:ùëñsuperscriptsubscript^‚Ñìùëñùëò0minsuperscriptsubscript^‚ÑìùëñùëòùëÄ\sigma_{q}^{k}=\underset{i:\hat{\ell}_{i}^{k}\neq 0}{\mathrm{min}}\hat{\ell}_{% i}^{k}/M.italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = start_UNDERACCENT italic_i : over^ start_ARG roman_‚Ñì end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚â† 0 end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG roman_min end_ARG over^ start_ARG roman_‚Ñì end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT / italic_M . (21)

Here, MùëÄMitalic_M is a tuning parameter, to be selected ad hoc. Note in fact, that setting MùëÄMitalic_M arbitrarily large, the bound ‚à•wk‚à•‚àû‚â§min‚Å¢{‚Ñìk}subscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•superscriptùë§ùëòminsuperscript‚Ñìùëò\lVert w^{k}\rVert_{\infty}\leq\mathrm{min}\{\ell^{k}\}‚à• italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àû end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ roman_min { roman_‚Ñì start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT } becomes looser, but this gives more trust in the process model, resulting in poor learning performances in the posterior estimates.

The measurement noise vùë£vitalic_v, is tuned by maximizing the measurement likelihood as in [47, Section 3D]. To this end, we solve the following optimization problem online:

(œÉrk)2=arg(œÉr)2‚Å¢max‚Å¢P‚Å¢(Œî‚Å¢xssk+1,œÑi+1|Œî‚Å¢p~k,œÑi)superscriptsuperscriptsubscriptùúéùëüùëò2superscriptsubscriptùúéùëü2argmaxùëÉconditionalŒîsuperscriptsubscriptùë•ssùëò1subscriptùúèùëñ1Œîsuperscript~ùëùùëòsubscriptùúèùëñ\displaystyle(\sigma_{r}^{k})^{2}=\underset{(\sigma_{r})^{2}}{\mathrm{arg}}{% \mathrm{max}}\ P\Big{(}\Delta{x}_{\rm ss}^{k+1,\tau_{i}+1}\ |\ \Delta\tilde{p}% ^{k,\tau_{i}}\Big{)}( italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = start_UNDERACCENT ( italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG roman_arg end_ARG roman_max italic_P ( roman_Œî italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ss end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 , italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | roman_Œî over~ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k , italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) (22)

The intuition behind (22) is to find the noise characteristics of vùë£vitalic_v that best represent the measurement model in (11) using the input Œî‚Å¢pŒîùëù\Delta proman_Œî italic_p and output Œî‚Å¢xŒîùë•\Delta{x}roman_Œî italic_x information. Note that, since the true measurements Œî‚Å¢xŒîùë•\Delta xroman_Œî italic_x are unavailable, they are replaced with¬†Œî‚Å¢x^Œî^ùë•\Delta\hat{x}roman_Œî over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG.

5.5 Proof of Lemma 3.6

Due to Assumption 2 and Lemma 1, for any p,x1,x2‚àà‚Ñùnùëùsubscriptùë•1subscriptùë•2superscript‚Ñùùëõp,x_{1},x_{2}\in\mathbb{R}^{n}italic_p , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT it holds that

œÜctr‚Å¢(p,x1)‚àíœÜctr‚Å¢(p,x2)‚àí(‚àáxœÜctr)‚ä§‚Å¢(p,x2)‚Å¢(x1‚àíx2)‚â§12‚Å¢Lx‚Å¢‚à•x1‚àíx2‚à•2.superscriptùúëctrùëùsubscriptùë•1superscriptùúëctrùëùsubscriptùë•2superscriptsubscript‚àáùë•superscriptùúëctrtopùëùsubscriptùë•2subscriptùë•1subscriptùë•212subscriptùêøùë•superscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•subscriptùë•1subscriptùë•22\varphi^{\mathrm{ctr}}(p,x_{1})-\varphi^{\mathrm{ctr}}(p,x_{2})-(\nabla_{x}% \varphi^{\mathrm{ctr}})^{\top}(p,x_{2})(x_{1}-x_{2})\leq\frac{1}{2}L_{x}\lVert x% _{1}-x_{2}\rVert^{2}.italic_œÜ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ctr end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_p , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_œÜ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ctr end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_p , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - ( ‚àá start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÜ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ctr end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_p , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ‚â§ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚à• italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT .

In the above equation, we replace x1,x2subscriptùë•1subscriptùë•2x_{1},x_{2}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT with x+Œº‚Å¢eiùë•ùúásubscriptùëíùëñx+\mu e_{i}italic_x + italic_Œº italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and xùë•xitalic_x, respectively, so that

œÜctr‚Å¢(p,x+Œº‚Å¢ei)‚àíœÜctr‚Å¢(p,x)‚àíŒº‚Å¢(‚àáxœÜctr)‚ä§‚Å¢(p,x)‚Å¢ei‚â§12‚Å¢Lx‚Å¢Œº2.superscriptùúëctrùëùùë•ùúásubscriptùëíùëñsuperscriptùúëctrùëùùë•ùúásuperscriptsubscript‚àáùë•superscriptùúëctrtopùëùùë•subscriptùëíùëñ12subscriptùêøùë•superscriptùúá2\varphi^{\mathrm{ctr}}(p,x+\mu e_{i})-\varphi^{\mathrm{ctr}}(p,x)-\mu(\nabla_{% x}\varphi^{\mathrm{ctr}})^{\top}(p,x)e_{i}\leq\frac{1}{2}L_{x}\mu^{2}.italic_œÜ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ctr end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_p , italic_x + italic_Œº italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_œÜ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ctr end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_p , italic_x ) - italic_Œº ( ‚àá start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÜ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ctr end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_p , italic_x ) italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œº start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT . (23)

We now add and subtract œÜ^ctr‚Å¢(p,x^+Œº‚Å¢ei)superscript^ùúëctrùëù^ùë•ùúásubscriptùëíùëñ\hat{\varphi}^{\mathrm{ctr}}(p,\hat{x}+\mu e_{i})over^ start_ARG italic_œÜ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ctr end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_p , over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG + italic_Œº italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and œÜ^ctr‚Å¢(p,x^)superscript^ùúëctrùëù^ùë•\hat{\varphi}^{\mathrm{ctr}}(p,\hat{x})over^ start_ARG italic_œÜ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ctr end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_p , over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ) in the above equation and we note that œÜ^ctr‚Å¢(p,x^):=‚àí1n‚ä§‚Å¢g^‚Å¢(p,x^)assignsuperscript^ùúëctrùëù^ùë•superscriptsubscript1ùëõtop^ùëîùëù^ùë•\hat{\varphi}^{\mathrm{ctr}}(p,\hat{x}):=-1_{n}^{\top}\hat{g}(p,\hat{x})over^ start_ARG italic_œÜ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ctr end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_p , over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ) := - 1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_g end_ARG ( italic_p , over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ) and œÜctr‚Å¢(p,x):=‚àí1n‚ä§‚Å¢g‚Å¢(p,x)assignsuperscriptùúëctrùëùùë•superscriptsubscript1ùëõtopùëîùëùùë•\varphi^{\mathrm{ctr}}(p,x):=-1_{n}^{\top}g(p,x)italic_œÜ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ctr end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_p , italic_x ) := - 1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_g ( italic_p , italic_x ). œÜ^ctr‚Å¢(p,x^+Œº‚Å¢ei)superscript^ùúëctrùëù^ùë•ùúásubscriptùëíùëñ\displaystyle\hat{\varphi}^{\mathrm{ctr}}(p,\hat{x}+\mu e_{i})over^ start_ARG italic_œÜ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ctr end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_p , over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG + italic_Œº italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ‚àíœÜ^ctr‚Å¢(p,x^)‚â§1n‚ä§‚Å¢[ey‚Å¢(p,x)+ey‚Å¢(p,x+Œº‚Å¢ei)]superscript^ùúëctrùëù^ùë•superscriptsubscript1ùëõtopdelimited-[]subscriptùëíùë¶ùëùùë•subscriptùëíùë¶ùëùùë•ùúásubscriptùëíùëñ\displaystyle-\hat{\varphi}^{\mathrm{ctr}}(p,\hat{x})\leq 1_{n}^{\top}[e_{y}(p% ,x)+e_{y}(p,x+\mu e_{i})]- over^ start_ARG italic_œÜ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ctr end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_p , over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ) ‚â§ 1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT [ italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_p , italic_x ) + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_p , italic_x + italic_Œº italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ]

where ey‚Å¢(p,x)subscriptùëíùë¶ùëùùë•e_{y}(p,x)italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_p , italic_x ) is the clicking behaviour estimation error as defined in (9). for all i‚àà[n]ùëñdelimited-[]ùëõi\in[n]italic_i ‚àà [ italic_n ]. Taking the modulus on both sides, we obtain |1n‚ä§‚Å¢(ey‚Å¢(p,x)+ey‚Å¢(p,x+Œº‚Å¢ei))|‚â§n‚Å¢œµgsuperscriptsubscript1ùëõtopsubscriptùëíùë¶ùëùùë•subscriptùëíùë¶ùëùùë•ùúásubscriptùëíùëñùëõsubscriptitalic-œµùëî|1_{n}^{\top}(e_{y}(p,x)+e_{y}(p,x+\mu e_{i}))|\leq\sqrt{n}\epsilon_{g}| 1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_p , italic_x ) + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_p , italic_x + italic_Œº italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) | ‚â§ square-root start_ARG italic_n end_ARG italic_œµ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_g end_POSTSUBSCRIPT using the Cauchy-Schwartz inequality and the upper-bound on the clicking behaviour estimation error ‚à•ey‚à•‚â§œµgdelimited-‚à•‚à•subscriptùëíùë¶subscriptitalic-œµùëî\lVert e_{y}\rVert\leq\epsilon_{g}‚à• italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚à• ‚â§ italic_œµ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_g end_POSTSUBSCRIPT as in (9). We now write

|(‚àáxœÜ^ctr)i‚Å¢(p,x^)‚àí(‚àáxœÜctr)i‚Å¢(p,x)|‚â§12‚Å¢Lx‚Å¢Œº+2‚Å¢n‚Å¢œµgŒº,subscriptsubscript‚àáùë•superscript^ùúëctrùëñùëù^ùë•subscriptsubscript‚àáùë•superscriptùúëctrùëñùëùùë•12subscriptùêøùë•ùúá2ùëõsubscriptitalic-œµùëîùúá\Big{|}\Big{(}\nabla_{x}\hat{\varphi}^{\mathrm{ctr}}\Big{)}_{i}(p,\hat{x})-% \Big{(}\nabla_{x}{\varphi}^{\mathrm{ctr}}\Big{)}_{i}(p,x)\Big{|}\leq\frac{1}{2% }L_{x}\mu+2\frac{\sqrt{n}\epsilon_{g}}{\mu},| ( ‚àá start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_œÜ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ctr end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_p , over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ) - ( ‚àá start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÜ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ctr end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_p , italic_x ) | ‚â§ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œº + 2 divide start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_n end_ARG italic_œµ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_g end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_Œº end_ARG ,

from which (14) follows. Analogous reasoning is followed for the gradient estimation error with respect to pùëùpitalic_p. To obtain the tight upper-bound, we use first-order optimality conditions with respect to Œºùúá\muitalic_Œº on the term 12‚Å¢Lx‚Å¢Œº+2‚Å¢n‚Å¢œµgŒº12subscriptùêøùë•ùúá2ùëõsubscriptitalic-œµùëîùúá\frac{1}{2}L_{x}\mu+2\frac{\sqrt{n}\epsilon_{g}}{\mu}divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œº + 2 divide start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_n end_ARG italic_œµ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_g end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_Œº end_ARG, thus obtaining Œº‚àó=2‚Å¢n1/4‚Å¢œµg/Lxsuperscriptùúá2superscriptùëõ14subscriptitalic-œµùëîsubscriptùêøùë•\mu^{*}=2n^{1/4}\sqrt{\epsilon_{g}/L_{x}}italic_Œº start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = 2 italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 / 4 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT square-root start_ARG italic_œµ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_g end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG. Since the second-order derivative of the term 12‚Å¢Lx‚Å¢Œº+2‚Å¢n‚Å¢œµgŒº12subscriptùêøùë•ùúá2ùëõsubscriptitalic-œµùëîùúá\frac{1}{2}L_{x}\mu+2\frac{\sqrt{n}\epsilon_{g}}{\mu}divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œº + 2 divide start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_n end_ARG italic_œµ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_g end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_Œº end_ARG is strictly positive, Œº‚àósuperscriptùúá\mu^{*}italic_Œº start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is the smoothing parameter that provides the lowest upper-bound on the gradient estimation error.

5.6 Proof of Theorem 3.8

The Kalman filter is uniformly asymptotically stable provided the pairs (In2,Qk),(In2,Œî‚Å¢p~k,œÑi)subscriptùêºsuperscriptùëõ2superscriptùëÑùëòsubscriptùêºsuperscriptùëõ2Œîsuperscript~ùëùùëòsubscriptùúèùëñ(I_{n^{2}},\sqrt{Q^{k}}),(I_{n^{2}},\Delta\tilde{p}^{k,\tau_{i}})( italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , square-root start_ARG italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ) , ( italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , roman_Œî over~ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k , italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) are uniformly completely controllable and observable, respectively [48, Theorem 7.4]. By design (see Appendix 5.4), the process noise covariance QksuperscriptùëÑùëòQ^{k}italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is positive definite ‚àÄk‚àà‚Ñï0for-allùëòsubscript‚Ñï0\forall k\in\mathbb{N}_{0}‚àÄ italic_k ‚àà blackboard_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, from which the matrix pair (In2,Qk)subscriptùêºsuperscriptùëõ2superscriptùëÑùëò(I_{n^{2}},\sqrt{Q^{k}})( italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , square-root start_ARG italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ) is uniformly completely controllable.

To prove observability of (In2,Œî‚Å¢p~k,œÑi)subscriptùêºsuperscriptùëõ2Œîsuperscript~ùëùùëòsubscriptùúèùëñ(I_{n^{2}},\Delta\tilde{p}^{k,\tau_{i}})( italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , roman_Œî over~ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k , italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ), we consider the following observability Gramian matrix [48, Chapter 7.5]:

WO‚Å¢(l1,l2):=‚àël=l1l2(Œî‚Å¢p~œÑi‚àíl+1,œÑi‚àíl)‚ä§‚Å¢(RœÑi‚àíl+1)‚àí1‚Å¢(Œî‚Å¢p~œÑi‚àíl+1,œÑi‚àíl).assignsubscriptùëäùëÇsubscriptùëô1subscriptùëô2superscriptsubscriptùëôsubscriptùëô1subscriptùëô2superscriptŒîsuperscript~ùëùsubscriptùúèùëñùëô1subscriptùúèùëñùëôtopsuperscriptsuperscriptùëÖsubscriptùúèùëñùëô11Œîsuperscript~ùëùsubscriptùúèùëñùëô1subscriptùúèùëñùëôW_{O}(l_{1},l_{2}):=\sum_{l=l_{1}}^{l_{2}}(\Delta\tilde{p}^{\tau_{i-l+1},\tau_% {i-l}})^{\top}(R^{\tau_{i-l+1}})^{-1}(\Delta\tilde{p}^{\tau_{i-l+1},\tau_{i-l}% }).italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_O end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) := ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l = italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( roman_Œî over~ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i - italic_l + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i - italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i - italic_l + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( roman_Œî over~ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i - italic_l + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i - italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) . (25)

The matrix pair (In2,Œî‚Å¢p~k,œÑi)subscriptùêºsuperscriptùëõ2Œîsuperscript~ùëùùëòsubscriptùúèùëñ(I_{n^{2}},\Delta\tilde{p}^{k,\tau_{i}})( italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , roman_Œî over~ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k , italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) is said to be uniformly completely observable if ‚àÉŒ±,Œ≤>0ùõºùõΩ0\exists\ \alpha,\beta>0‚àÉ italic_Œ± , italic_Œ≤ > 0 and an N‚àà‚Ñï0:0<Œ±‚Å¢In2‚â§WO‚Å¢(k‚àíN,k)‚â§Œ≤‚Å¢In2:ùëÅsubscript‚Ñï00ùõºsubscriptùêºsuperscriptùëõ2subscriptùëäùëÇùëòùëÅùëòùõΩsubscriptùêºsuperscriptùëõ2N\in\mathbb{N}_{0}:0<\alpha I_{n^{2}}\leq W_{O}(k-N,k)\leq\beta I_{n^{2}}italic_N ‚àà blackboard_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : 0 < italic_Œ± italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_O end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_k - italic_N , italic_k ) ‚â§ italic_Œ≤ italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Since Œî‚Å¢p~t1,t2:=Œî‚Å¢pt1,t2‚äóInassignŒîsuperscript~ùëùsubscriptùë°1subscriptùë°2tensor-productŒîsuperscriptùëùsubscriptùë°1subscriptùë°2subscriptùêºùëõ\Delta\tilde{p}^{t_{1},t_{2}}:=\Delta p^{t_{1},t_{2}}\otimes I_{n}roman_Œî over~ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT := roman_Œî italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚äó italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, we write WO‚Å¢(l1,l2)=‚àël=l1l2(Œî‚Å¢pœÑi‚àíl+1,œÑi‚àíl)‚Å¢(Œî‚Å¢pœÑi‚àíl+1,œÑi‚àíl)‚ä§‚äó(RœÑi‚àíl+1)‚àí1subscriptùëäùëÇsubscriptùëô1subscriptùëô2superscriptsubscriptùëôsubscriptùëô1subscriptùëô2tensor-productŒîsuperscriptùëùsubscriptùúèùëñùëô1subscriptùúèùëñùëôsuperscriptŒîsuperscriptùëùsubscriptùúèùëñùëô1subscriptùúèùëñùëôtopsuperscriptsuperscriptùëÖsubscriptùúèùëñùëô11W_{O}(l_{1},l_{2})=\sum_{l=l_{1}}^{l_{2}}(\Delta{p}^{\tau_{i-l+1},\tau_{i-l}})% (\Delta{p}^{\tau_{i-l+1},\tau_{i-l}})^{\top}\otimes(R^{\tau_{i-l+1}})^{-1}italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_O end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l = italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( roman_Œî italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i - Moreover, the persistency of excitation assumption (see Assumption 5) on the inputs Œî‚Å¢pŒîùëù\Delta proman_Œî italic_p enable us to state that ‚àÉS‚àà‚Ñï0:Œ≤1‚Å¢In‚â§‚àël=k‚àíSk(Œî‚Å¢pœÑi‚àíl+1,œÑi‚àíl)‚Å¢(Œî‚Å¢pœÑi‚àíl+1,œÑi‚àíl)‚ä§‚â§Œ≤2‚Å¢In:ùëÜsubscript‚Ñï0subscriptùõΩ1subscriptùêºùëõsuperscriptsubscriptùëôùëòùëÜùëòŒîsuperscriptùëùsubscriptùúèùëñùëô1subscriptùúèùëñùëôsuperscriptŒîsuperscriptùëùsubscriptùúèùëñùëô1subscriptùúèùëñùëôtopsubscriptùõΩ2subscriptùêºùëõ\exists\ S\in\mathbb{N}_{0}:\beta_{1}I_{n}\leq\sum_{l=k-S}^{k}(\Delta{p}^{\tau% _{i-l+1},\tau_{i-l}})(\Delta{p}^{\tau_{i-l+1},\tau_{i-l}})^{\top}\leq\beta_{2}% I_{n}‚àÉ italic_S ‚àà blackboard_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l = italic_k - Thus, the matrix pair (In2,Œî‚Å¢p~k,œÑi)subscriptùêºsuperscriptùëõ2Œîsuperscript~ùëùùëòsubscriptùúèùëñ(I_{n^{2}},\Delta\tilde{p}^{k,\tau_{i}})( italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , roman_Œî over~ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k , italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) is uniformly completely observable and it is now possible to state that the Kalman filter is uniformly asymptotically stable.

We can now derive an explicit analytical expression for the upper-bound on the bias ‚à•ùîº‚Å¢[ek]‚à•delimited-‚à•‚à•ùîºdelimited-[]superscriptùëíùëò\lVert\mathbb{E}[e^{k}]\rVert‚à• blackboard_E [ italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ‚à• and the variance ùîº‚Å¢[‚à•ek‚à•2]ùîºdelimited-[]superscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•superscriptùëíùëò2\mathbb{E}[\lVert e^{k}\rVert^{2}]blackboard_E [ ‚à• italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ]. By making use of (10) and (3.2.1) on ‚Ñìksuperscript‚Ñìùëò\ell^{k}roman_‚Ñì start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and ‚Ñì^ksuperscript^‚Ñìùëò\hat{\ell}^{k}over^ start_ARG roman_‚Ñì end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, by adding and subtracting Œî‚Å¢xssk+1,œÑi+1Œîsuperscriptsubscriptùë•ssùëò1subscriptùúèùëñ1\Delta x_{\rm ss}^{k+1,\tau_{i}+1}roman_Œî italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ss end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 , italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPTand by making use of (10) and (11) on Œî‚Å¢xssk+1,œÑi+1Œîsuperscriptsubscriptùë•ssùëò1subscriptùúèùëñ1\Delta x_{\rm ss}^{k+1,\tau_{i}+1}roman_Œî italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ss end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 , italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, one gets

eksuperscriptùëíùëò\displaystyle e^{k}italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT =(In2‚àíŒ∂k‚Å¢Kk‚àí1‚Å¢Œî‚Å¢p~k,œÑi)‚Å¢(ek‚àí1+wk‚àí1)‚àíŒ∂k‚Å¢Kk‚àí1‚Å¢vkabsentsubscriptùêºsuperscriptùëõ2superscriptùúÅùëòsuperscriptùêæùëò1Œîsuperscript~ùëùùëòsubscriptùúèùëñsuperscriptùëíùëò1superscriptùë§ùëò1superscriptùúÅùëòsuperscriptùêæùëò1superscriptùë£ùëò\displaystyle=\big{(}I_{n^{2}}-\zeta^{k}K^{k-1}\Delta\tilde{p}^{k,\tau_{i}}% \big{)}(e^{k-1}+w^{k-1})-\zeta^{k}K^{k-1}v^{k}= ( italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_Œ∂ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_Œî over~ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k , italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ( italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_Œ∂ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_v start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT
+Œ∂k‚Å¢Kk‚àí1‚Å¢Œî‚Å¢exœÑi+1,k+1.superscriptùúÅùëòsuperscriptùêæùëò1Œîsuperscriptsubscriptùëíùë•subscriptùúèùëñ1ùëò1\displaystyle+\ \zeta^{k}K^{k-1}\Delta e_{x}^{\tau_{i}+1,k+1}.+ italic_Œ∂ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_Œî italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 , italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT . (26)

Considering a trigger event at kùëòkitalic_k, i.e. Œ∂k=1superscriptùúÅùëò1\zeta^{k}=1italic_Œ∂ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = 1, we trace (26) back to the previous trigger instant at œÑisubscriptùúèùëñ\tau_{i}italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, thus obtaining:

ek=superscriptùëíùëòabsent\displaystyle e^{k}=italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = (In2‚àíKk‚àí1‚Å¢Œî‚Å¢p~k,œÑi)‚Å¢eœÑi+(In2‚àíKk‚àí1‚Å¢Œî‚Å¢p~k,œÑi)‚Å¢wk‚àí1+subscriptùêºsuperscriptùëõ2superscriptùêæùëò1Œîsuperscript~ùëùùëòsubscriptùúèùëñsuperscriptùëísubscriptùúèùëñlimit-fromsubscriptùêºsuperscriptùëõ2superscriptùêæùëò1Œîsuperscript~ùëùùëòsubscriptùúèùëñsuperscriptùë§ùëò1\displaystyle\big{(}I_{n^{2}}-K^{k-1}\Delta\tilde{p}^{k,\tau_{i}}\big{)}e^{% \tau_{i}}+\big{(}I_{n^{2}}-K^{k-1}\Delta\tilde{p}^{k,\tau_{i}}\big{)}w^{k-1}+( italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_Œî over~ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k , italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + ( italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_Œî over~ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k , italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT +
‚àët=œÑik‚àí2wt‚àíKk‚àí1‚Å¢vk+Kk‚àí1‚Å¢Œî‚Å¢exœÑi+1,k+1.superscriptsubscriptùë°subscriptùúèùëñùëò2superscriptùë§ùë°superscriptùêæùëò1superscriptùë£ùëòsuperscriptùêæùëò1Œîsuperscriptsubscriptùëíùë•subscriptùúèùëñ1ùëò1\displaystyle\sum_{t=\tau_{i}}^{k-2}w^{t}-K^{k-1}v^{k}+K^{k-1}\Delta e_{x}^{% \tau_{i}+1,k+1}.‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t = italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k - 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_v start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_Œî italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 , italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT . (27)

Taking the expectation on both sides of the above equation and using Assumption 4, we have:

ùîº‚Å¢[ek]=(In2‚àíKk‚àí1‚Å¢Œî‚Å¢p~k,œÑi)‚Å¢ùîº‚Å¢[eœÑi]+Kk‚àí1‚Å¢ùîº‚Å¢[Œî‚Å¢exœÑi+1,k+1].ùîºdelimited-[]superscriptùëíùëòsubscriptùêºsuperscriptùëõ2superscriptùêæùëò1Œîsuperscript~ùëùùëòsubscriptùúèùëñùîºdelimited-[]superscriptùëísubscriptùúèùëñsuperscriptùêæùëò1ùîºdelimited-[]Œîsuperscriptsubscriptùëíùë•subscriptùúèùëñ1ùëò1\mathbb{E}[e^{k}]=\big{(}I_{n^{2}}-K^{k-1}\Delta\tilde{p}^{k,\tau_{i}}\big{)}% \mathbb{E}[e^{\tau_{i}}]+K^{k-1}\mathbb{E}[\Delta e_{x}^{\tau_{i}+1,k+1}].blackboard_E [ italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] = ( italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_Œî over~ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k , italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) blackboard_E [ italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] + italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E [ roman_Œî italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 , italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] . (28)

Since we have already established uniform complete observability, the Kalman filter gain KksuperscriptùêæùëòK^{k}italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT settles to a steady-state value Kssubscriptùêæùë†K_{s}italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT as k‚Üí‚àû‚Üíùëòk\to\inftyitalic_k ‚Üí ‚àû. Thus, we can state that ‚àÉKm:‚à•Kk‚à•‚â§Km,‚àÄk‚àà‚Ñï0:subscriptùêæùëöformulae-sequencedelimited-‚à•‚à•superscriptùêæùëòsubscriptùêæùëöfor-allùëòsuperscript‚Ñï0\exists\ K_{m}:\lVert K^{k}\rVert\leq K_{m},\forall\ k\in\mathbb{N}^{0}‚àÉ italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : ‚à• italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• ‚â§ italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ‚àÄ italic_k ‚àà blackboard_N start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Further, denoting œà‚Å¢(œÑi+1,œÑi):=In2‚àíKœÑi+1‚àí1‚Å¢Œî‚Å¢p~œÑi+1,œÑiassignùúìsubscriptùúèùëñ1subscriptùúèùëñsubscriptùêºsuperscriptùëõ2superscriptùêæsubscriptùúèùëñ11Œîsuperscript~ùëùsubscriptùúèùëñ1subscriptùúèùëñ\psi(\tau_{i+1},\tau_{i}):=I_{n^{2}}-K^{\tau_{i+1}-1}\Delta\tilde{p}^{\tau_{i+% 1},\tau_{i}}italic_œà ( italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) := italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_Œî over~ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT as the state transition matrix for the Kalman filter error eksuperscriptùëíùëòe^{k}italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, uniform asymptotic stability leads to ‚à•œà‚Å¢(œÑi+1,œÑi)‚à•‚â§c1‚Å¢Œæc2‚Å¢Tdelimited-‚à•‚à•ùúìsubscriptùúèùëñ1subscriptùúèùëñsubscriptùëê1superscriptùúâsubscriptùëê2ùëá\lVert\psi(\tau_{i+1},\tau_{i})\rVert\leq c_{1}\xi^{c_{2}T}‚à• italic_œà ( italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ‚à• ‚â§ italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œæ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT for some c1,c2>0,Œæ‚àà(0,1):c1Œæc2‚Å¢T<1c_{1},c_{2}>0,\xi\in(0,1):c_{1}\xi^{c_{2}T}<1italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0 , italic_Œæ ‚àà ( 0 , 1 ) : italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œæ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT < 1, where œÑi+1=ksubscriptùúèùëñ1ùëò\tau_{i+1}=kitalic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_k is the new trigger time instant and TùëáTitalic_T is the time period. Thus, taking the norm on both sides in (28), we have ‚à•ùîº‚Å¢[eœÑi+1]‚à•‚â§c1‚Å¢Œæc2‚Å¢T‚Å¢‚à•ùîº‚Å¢[eœÑi]‚à•+2‚Å¢Km‚Å¢œµxdelimited-‚à•‚à•ùîºdelimited-[]superscriptùëísubscriptùúèùëñ1subscriptùëê1superscriptùúâsubscriptùëê2ùëádelimited-‚à•‚à•ùîºdelimited-[]superscriptùëísubscriptùúèùëñ2subscriptùêæùëösubscriptitalic-œµùë•\lVert\mathbb{E}[e^{\tau_{i+1}}]\rVert\leq c_{1}\xi^{c_{2}T}\lVert\mathbb{E}[e% ^{\tau_{i}}]\rVert+2K_{m}\epsilon_{x}‚à• blackboard_E [ italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ‚à• ‚â§ italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œæ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• blackboard_E [ italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ‚à• + 2 italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œµ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, where we note that sup‚Å¢‚à•ùîº‚Å¢[Œî‚Å¢exœÑi+1,k+1]‚à•‚â§ùîº‚Å¢[‚à•Œî‚Å¢exœÑi+1,k+1‚à•]‚â§2‚Å¢œµxsupdelimited-‚à•‚à•ùîºdelimited-[]Œîsuperscriptsubscriptùëíùë•subscriptùúèùëñ1ùëò1ùîºdelimited-[]delimited-‚à•‚à•Œîsuperscriptsubscriptùëíùë•subscriptùúèùëñ1ùëò12subscriptitalic-œµùë•\mathrm{sup}\ \lVert\mathbb{E}[\Delta e_{x}^{\tau_{i}+1,k+1}]\rVert\leq\mathbb% {E}[\lVert\Delta e_{x}^{\tau_{i}+1,k+1}\rVert]\leq 2\epsilon_{x}roman_sup ‚à• blackboard_E [ roman_Œî italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 , italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ‚à• ‚â§ blackboard_E [ ‚à• roman_Œî italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 , italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• ] ‚â§ 2 italic_œµ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT from Lemma 2. Hence, we derive the bias equation

‚à•ùîº‚Å¢[eœÑi+1]‚à•‚â§(c1‚Å¢Œæc2‚Å¢T)|ùíØ|‚Å¢‚à•ùîº‚Å¢[e0]‚à•+2‚Å¢Km‚Å¢œµx‚Å¢1‚àí(c1‚Å¢Œæc2‚Å¢T)|ùíØ|1‚àíc1‚Å¢Œæc2‚Å¢T,delimited-‚à•‚à•ùîºdelimited-[]superscriptùëísubscriptùúèùëñ1superscriptsubscriptùëê1superscriptùúâsubscriptùëê2ùëáùíØdelimited-‚à•‚à•ùîºdelimited-[]superscriptùëí02subscriptùêæùëösubscriptitalic-œµùë•1superscriptsubscriptùëê1superscriptùúâsubscriptùëê2ùëáùíØ1subscriptùëê1superscriptùúâsubscriptùëê2ùëá\lVert\mathbb{E}[e^{\tau_{i+1}}]\rVert\leq\big{(}c_{1}\xi^{c_{2}T}\big{)}^{|% \mathcal{T}|}\lVert\mathbb{E}[e^{0}]\rVert+2K_{m}\epsilon_{x}\frac{1-(c_{1}\xi% ^{c_{2}T})^{|\mathcal{T}|}}{1-c_{1}\xi^{c_{2}T}},‚à• blackboard_E [ italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ‚à• ‚â§ ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œæ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | caligraphic_T | end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• blackboard_E [ italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ‚à• + 2 italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œµ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 - ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œæ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | caligraphic_T | end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œæ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ,

where, ùíØ:={œÑ0,œÑ1,‚Ä¶,œÑi}assignùíØsubscriptùúè0subscriptùúè1‚Ä¶subscriptùúèùëñ\mathcal{T}:=\{\tau_{0},\tau_{1},\dots,\tau_{i}\}caligraphic_T := { italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ‚Ä¶ , italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } is the set of all trigger time instances upto œÑisubscriptùúèùëñ\tau_{i}italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Thus, we have the asymptotic result on the bias lim|ùíØ|‚Üí‚àûùîº‚Å¢[eœÑi]‚â§2‚Å¢Km‚Å¢œµx/(1‚àíc1‚Å¢Œæc2‚Å¢T)subscript‚ÜíùíØùîºdelimited-[]superscriptùëísubscriptùúèùëñ2subscriptùêæùëösubscriptitalic-œµùë•1subscriptùëê1superscriptùúâsubscriptùëê2ùëá\lim_{|\mathcal{T}|\to\infty}\mathbb{E}[e^{\tau_{i}}]\leq 2K_{m}\epsilon_{x}/(% 1-c_{1}\xi^{c_{2}T})roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_T | ‚Üí ‚àû end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_E [ italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ‚â§ 2 italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œµ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / ( 1 - italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œæ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ).

We now derive the upper-bound on the variance ùîº‚Å¢[‚à•ek‚à•2]ùîºdelimited-[]superscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•superscriptùëíùëò2\mathbb{E}[\lVert e^{k}\rVert^{2}]blackboard_E [ ‚à• italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ]. In (b)ùëè(b)( italic_b ), we expand the norm and use Assumption 4 to state that the expectation on the cross-coupled terms are all zero. Further, Lemma 2 allows us to state that ùîº‚Å¢[‚à•Œî‚Å¢exk+1,œÑi+1‚à•2]‚â§2‚Å¢œµx2ùîºdelimited-[]superscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•Œîsuperscriptsubscriptùëíùë•ùëò1subscriptùúèùëñ122superscriptsubscriptitalic-œµùë•2\mathbb{E}[\lVert\Delta e_{x}^{k+1,\tau_{i}+1}\rVert^{2}]\leq 2\epsilon_{x}^{2}blackboard_E [ ‚à• roman_Œî italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 , italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ‚â§ 2 italic_œµ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Considering a trigger at time kùëòkitalic_k, we have:

ùîº‚Å¢[‚à•eœÑi+1‚à•2]‚â§ùîºdelimited-[]superscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•superscriptùëísubscriptùúèùëñ12absent\displaystyle\mathbb{E}[\lVert e^{\tau_{i+1}}\rVert^{2}]\leqblackboard_E [ ‚à• italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ‚â§ ‚à•In2‚àíKœÑi+1‚àí1‚Å¢Œî‚Å¢p~œÑi+1,œÑi‚à•2‚Å¢ùîº‚Å¢[‚à•eœÑi‚à•2]+limit-fromsuperscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•subscriptùêºsuperscriptùëõ2superscriptùêæsubscriptùúèùëñ11Œîsuperscript~ùëùsubscriptùúèùëñ1subscriptùúèùëñ2ùîºdelimited-[]superscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•superscriptùëísubscriptùúèùëñ2\displaystyle\lVert I_{n^{2}}-K^{\tau_{i+1}-1}\Delta\tilde{p}^{\tau_{i+1},\tau% _{i}}\rVert^{2}\mathbb{E}[\lVert e^{\tau_{i}}\rVert^{2}]+‚à• italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_Œî over~ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E [ ‚à• italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] +
(T‚àí1)‚Å¢œÉ¬Øq2+‚à•KœÑi+1‚àí1‚à•2‚Å¢(œÉ¬Ør2+2‚Å¢œµx2),ùëá1superscriptsubscript¬Øùúéùëû2superscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•superscriptùêæsubscriptùúèùëñ112superscriptsubscript¬Øùúéùëü22superscriptsubscriptitalic-œµùë•2\displaystyle(T-1)\overline{\sigma}_{q}^{2}+\lVert K^{\tau_{i+1}-1}\rVert^{2}% \big{(}\overline{\sigma}_{r}^{2}+2\epsilon_{x}^{2}\big{)},( italic_T - 1 ) over¬Ø start_ARG italic_œÉ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + ‚à• italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( over¬Ø start_ARG italic_œÉ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + 2 italic_œµ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) , (29)

where œÉ¬Øq2=supt‚àà‚Ñï0‚Å¢(œÉqt)2superscriptsubscript¬Øùúéùëû2ùë°subscript‚Ñï0supsuperscriptsuperscriptsubscriptùúéùëûùë°2\overline{\sigma}_{q}^{2}=\underset{t\in\mathbb{N}_{0}}{\mathrm{sup}}({\sigma}% _{q}^{t})^{2}over¬Ø start_ARG italic_œÉ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = start_UNDERACCENT italic_t ‚àà blackboard_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG roman_sup end_ARG ( italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and œÉ¬Ør2=supt‚àà‚Ñï0‚Å¢(œÉrt)2superscriptsubscript¬Øùúéùëü2ùë°subscript‚Ñï0supsuperscriptsuperscriptsubscriptùúéùëüùë°2\overline{\sigma}_{r}^{2}=\underset{t\in\mathbb{N}_{0}}{\mathrm{sup}}({\sigma}% _{r}^{t})^{2}over¬Ø start_ARG italic_œÉ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = start_UNDERACCENT italic_t ‚àà blackboard_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG roman_sup end_ARG ( italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT with œÉq,œÉrsubscriptùúéùëûsubscriptùúéùëü\sigma_{q},\sigma_{r}italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT estimated using (21) and (22), respectively. Tracing back (5.6) recursively to k=0ùëò0k=0italic_k = 0, we obtain the following relation:

ùîº‚Å¢[‚à•eœÑi+1‚à•2]‚â§ùîºdelimited-[]superscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•superscriptùëísubscriptùúèùëñ12absent\displaystyle\mathbb{E}[\lVert e^{\tau_{i+1}}\rVert^{2}]\leqblackboard_E [ ‚à• italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ‚â§ (c1‚Å¢Œæc2‚Å¢T)2‚Å¢|ùíØ|‚Å¢ùîº‚Å¢[‚à•e0‚à•2]+limit-fromsuperscriptsubscriptùëê1superscriptùúâsubscriptùëê2ùëá2ùíØùîºdelimited-[]superscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•superscriptùëí02\displaystyle(c_{1}\xi^{c_{2}T})^{2|\mathcal{T}|}\mathbb{E}[\lVert e^{0}\rVert% ^{2}]+( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œæ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 | caligraphic_T | end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E [ ‚à• italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] +
1‚àí(c1‚Å¢Œæc2‚Å¢T)2‚Å¢|ùíØ|1‚àíc1‚Å¢Œæc2‚Å¢T‚Å¢[(T‚àí1)‚Å¢œÉ¬Øq2+Km2‚Å¢(œÉ¬Ør2+2‚Å¢œµx2)],1superscriptsubscriptùëê1superscriptùúâsubscriptùëê2ùëá2ùíØ1subscriptùëê1superscriptùúâsubscriptùëê2ùëádelimited-[]ùëá1superscriptsubscript¬Øùúéùëû2superscriptsubscriptùêæùëö2superscriptsubscript¬Øùúéùëü22superscriptsubscriptitalic-œµùë•2\displaystyle\frac{1-(c_{1}\xi^{c_{2}T})^{2|\mathcal{T}|}}{1-c_{1}\xi^{c_{2}T}% }\big{[}(T-1)\overline{\sigma}_{q}^{2}+K_{m}^{2}\big{(}\overline{\sigma}_{r}^{% 2}+2\epsilon_{x}^{2}\big{)}\big{]},divide start_ARG 1 - ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œæ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 | caligraphic_T | end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œæ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG [ ( italic_T - 1 ) over¬Ø start_ARG italic_œÉ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( over¬Ø start_ARG italic_œÉ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + 2 italic_œµ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] ,

We now have the following asymptotic result on the variance:

lim|ùíØ|‚Üí‚àûùîº‚Å¢[‚à•eœÑi‚à•2]‚â§11‚àíc1‚Å¢Œæc2‚Å¢T‚Å¢[(T‚àí1)‚Å¢œÉ¬Øq2+Km2‚Å¢(œÉ¬Ør2+2‚Å¢œµx2)],subscript‚ÜíùíØùîºdelimited-[]superscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•superscriptùëísubscriptùúèùëñ211subscriptùëê1superscriptùúâsubscriptùëê2ùëádelimited-[]ùëá1superscriptsubscript¬Øùúéùëû2superscriptsubscriptùêæùëö2superscriptsubscript¬Øùúéùëü22superscriptsubscriptitalic-œµùë•2\lim_{|\mathcal{T}|\to\infty}\mathbb{E}[\lVert e^{\tau_{i}}\rVert^{2}]\leq% \frac{1}{1-c_{1}\xi^{c_{2}T}}\big{[}(T-1)\overline{\sigma}_{q}^{2}+K_{m}^{2}% \big{(}\overline{\sigma}_{r}^{2}+2\epsilon_{x}^{2}\big{)}\big{]},roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_T | ‚Üí ‚àû end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_E [ ‚à• italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ‚â§ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œæ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG [ ( italic_T - 1 ) over¬Ø start_ARG italic_œÉ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( over¬Ø start_ARG italic_œÉ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + 2 italic_œµ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] ,

5.7 Proof of Theorem 3.10

Before describing the proof, we state the following supporting lemma and remark.

Lemma 5.14 (Projections with smooth functions [49]).

Let y=Œ†[‚àí1,1]n‚Å¢[x‚àíŒ∑‚Å¢u]ùë¶subscriptŒ†superscript11ùëõdelimited-[]ùë•ùúÇùë¢y=\Pi_{[-1,1]^{n}}[x-\eta u]italic_y = roman_Œ† start_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ - 1 , 1 ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_x - italic_Œ∑ italic_u ] with y,x,u‚àà‚Ñùnùë¶ùë•ùë¢superscript‚Ñùùëõy,x,u\in\mathbb{R}^{n}italic_y , italic_x , italic_u ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Then, the following inequality holds:

œÜ‚Å¢(y)‚â§ùúëùë¶absent\displaystyle\varphi(y)\leqitalic_œÜ ( italic_y ) ‚â§ œÜ‚Å¢(z)+‚ü®y‚àíz,Œ¶‚Å¢(x)‚àíu‚ü©+[L‚Ä≤2‚àí12‚Å¢Œ∑]‚Å¢‚à•y‚àíx‚à•2+ùúëùëßùë¶ùëßŒ¶ùë•ùë¢limit-fromdelimited-[]superscriptùêø‚Ä≤212ùúÇsuperscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•ùë¶ùë•2\displaystyle\varphi(z)+\langle y-z,\Phi(x)-u\rangle+\Big{[}\frac{L^{\prime}}{% 2}-\frac{1}{2\eta}\Big{]}\lVert y-x\rVert^{2}+italic_œÜ ( italic_z ) + ‚ü® italic_y - italic_z , roman_Œ¶ ( italic_x ) - italic_u ‚ü© + [ divide start_ARG italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_Œ∑ end_ARG ] ‚à• italic_y - italic_x ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT +
[L‚Ä≤2+12‚Å¢Œ∑]‚Å¢‚à•z‚àíx‚à•2‚àí12‚Å¢Œ∑‚Å¢‚à•y‚àíz‚à•2,‚àÄz‚àà‚Ñùndelimited-[]superscriptùêø‚Ä≤212ùúÇsuperscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•ùëßùë•212ùúÇsuperscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•ùë¶ùëß2for-allùëßsuperscript‚Ñùùëõ\displaystyle\Big{[}\frac{L^{\prime}}{2}+\frac{1}{2\eta}\Big{]}\lVert z-x% \rVert^{2}-\frac{1}{2\eta}\lVert y-z\rVert^{2},\quad\forall z\in\mathbb{R}^{n}[ divide start_ARG italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_Œ∑ end_ARG ] ‚à• italic_z - italic_x ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_Œ∑ end_ARG ‚à• italic_y - italic_z ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , ‚àÄ italic_z ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT

where œÜùúë\varphiitalic_œÜ is the cost function to be minimized and Œ¶Œ¶\Phiroman_Œ¶ its gradient. Further, L‚Ä≤superscriptùêø‚Ä≤L^{\prime}italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and Œ∑ùúÇ\etaitalic_Œ∑ are the smoothness factor of œÜùúë\varphiitalic_œÜ and the step-size of the gradient descent algorithm, respectively.

Proof 5.15.

The proof is given in [49, Lemma 2].

Remark 5.16 (Composite gradient lipschitzness).

We observe that the Lipschitz and smoothness constant for œÜpol‚Å¢(x)superscriptùúëpolùë•\varphi^{\mathrm{pol}}(x)italic_œÜ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_pol end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_x ) are 2‚Å¢n2ùëõ2\sqrt{n}2 square-root start_ARG italic_n end_ARG and 2222, respectively. Using Assumptions 1(iii), 2, the composite gradient Œ¶‚Å¢(p)Œ¶ùëù\Phi(p)roman_Œ¶ ( italic_p ) is thus L‚Ä≤‚àílimit-fromsuperscriptùêø‚Ä≤L^{\prime}-italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT -Lipschitz with respect to pùëùpitalic_p, where L‚Ä≤=Lp+L2‚Å¢(Lx+2)superscriptùêø‚Ä≤subscriptùêøùëùsuperscriptùêø2subscriptùêøùë•2L^{\prime}=L_{p}+L^{2}(L_{x}+2)italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 2 ). Therefore, the composite cost function œÜ‚Å¢(p,h‚Å¢(p,d))ùúëùëù‚Ñéùëùùëë\varphi(p,h(p,d))italic_œÜ ( italic_p , italic_h ( italic_p , italic_d ) ) is L‚Ä≤‚àílimit-fromsuperscriptùêø‚Ä≤L^{\prime}-italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT -smooth with respect to pùëùpitalic_p.

We now state the following gradient update in the case where the gradients, sensitivity and opinions are known:

p¬Øk+1=Œ†[‚àí1,1]n‚Å¢[pk‚àíŒ∑‚Å¢Œ¶‚Å¢(pk,h‚Å¢(pk,d))],superscript¬Øùëùùëò1subscriptŒ†superscript11ùëõdelimited-[]superscriptùëùùëòùúÇŒ¶superscriptùëùùëò‚Ñésuperscriptùëùùëòùëë\overline{p}^{k+1}=\Pi_{[-1,1]^{n}}[p^{k}-\eta\Phi(p^{k},h(p^{k},d))],over¬Ø start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = roman_Œ† start_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ - 1 , 1 ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_Œ∑ roman_Œ¶ ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_h ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_d ) ) ] ,

where Œ¶‚Å¢(p,h‚Å¢(p,d))Œ¶ùëù‚Ñéùëùùëë\Phi(p,h(p,d))roman_Œ¶ ( italic_p , italic_h ( italic_p , italic_d ) ) is the composite gradient. The above will serve as a benchmark to investigate the stationarity of our algorithm. We are now in the position to prove the inequalities in (19). To do so, we use Lemma 5.14 with y=p¬Øk+1ùë¶superscript¬Øùëùùëò1y=\overline{p}^{k+1}italic_y = over¬Ø start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, x=pkùë•superscriptùëùùëòx=p^{k}italic_x = italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and u=Œ¶‚Å¢(pk,h‚Å¢(pk,d))ùë¢Œ¶superscriptùëùùëò‚Ñésuperscriptùëùùëòùëëu=\Phi(p^{k},h(p^{k},d))italic_u = roman_Œ¶ ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_h ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_d ) ) is the composite gradient. Choosing z=pkùëßsuperscriptùëùùëòz=p^{k}italic_z = italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and taking the expectation on both sides, we obtain:

ùîº‚Å¢[œÜ‚Å¢(p¬Øk+1)]‚â§ùîº‚Å¢[œÜ‚Å¢(pk)+(L‚Ä≤2‚àí1Œ∑)‚Å¢‚à•p¬Øk+1‚àípk‚à•2].ùîºdelimited-[]ùúësuperscript¬Øùëùùëò1ùîºdelimited-[]ùúësuperscriptùëùùëòsuperscriptùêø‚Ä≤21ùúÇsuperscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•superscript¬Øùëùùëò1superscriptùëùùëò2\mathbb{E}\Big{[}\varphi(\overline{p}^{k+1})\Big{]}\leq\mathbb{E}\Big{[}% \varphi(p^{k})+\Big{(}\frac{L^{\prime}}{2}-\frac{1}{\eta}\Big{)}\lVert% \overline{p}^{k+1}-p^{k}\rVert^{2}\Big{]}.blackboard_E [ italic_œÜ ( over¬Ø start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] ‚â§ blackboard_E [ italic_œÜ ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + ( divide start_ARG italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_Œ∑ end_ARG ) ‚à• over¬Ø start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] . (30)

We now define the update step with our algorithm:

pk+1=Œ†[‚àí1,1]n‚Å¢[pk‚àíŒ∑‚Å¢Œ∂k‚Å¢Œ¶^k],superscriptùëùùëò1subscriptŒ†superscript11ùëõdelimited-[]superscriptùëùùëòùúÇsuperscriptùúÅùëòsuperscript^Œ¶ùëò{p}^{k+1}=\Pi_{[-1,1]^{n}}[p^{k}-\eta\zeta^{k}\hat{\Phi}^{k}],italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = roman_Œ† start_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ - 1 , 1 ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_Œ∑ italic_Œ∂ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT over^ start_ARG roman_Œ¶ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ,

where, the composite gradient estimate Œ¶^ksuperscript^Œ¶ùëò\hat{\Phi}^{k}over^ start_ARG roman_Œ¶ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is given in (17). We use Lemma 5.14 with y=pk+1ùë¶superscriptùëùùëò1y=p^{k+1}italic_y = italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, x=pkùë•superscriptùëùùëòx=p^{k}italic_x = italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and u=Œ∂k‚Å¢Œ¶^kùë¢superscriptùúÅùëòsuperscript^Œ¶ùëòu=\zeta^{k}\hat{\Phi}^{k}italic_u = italic_Œ∂ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT over^ start_ARG roman_Œ¶ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Choosing z=p¬Øk+1ùëßsuperscript¬Øùëùùëò1z=\overline{p}^{k+1}italic_z = over¬Ø start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and taking the expectation on both sides of the inequality, we obtain:

ùîº[œÜ(pk+1)]‚â§ùîº[\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\Big{[}\varphi(p^{k+1})\Big{]}\leq\mathbb{E}\Big{[}blackboard_E [ italic_œÜ ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] ‚â§ blackboard_E [ œÜ‚Å¢(p¬Øk+1)+(L‚Ä≤2‚àí12‚Å¢Œ∑)‚Å¢‚à•pk+1‚àípk‚à•2+ùúësuperscript¬Øùëùùëò1limit-fromsuperscriptùêø‚Ä≤212ùúÇsuperscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•superscriptùëùùëò1superscriptùëùùëò2\displaystyle\varphi(\overline{p}^{k+1})+\Big{(}\frac{L^{\prime}}{2}-\frac{1}{% 2\eta}\Big{)}\lVert p^{k+1}-p^{k}\rVert^{2}+italic_œÜ ( over¬Ø start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + ( divide start_ARG italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_Œ∑ end_ARG ) ‚à• italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT +

(L‚Ä≤2+12‚Å¢Œ∑)‚à•p¬Øk+1‚àípk‚à•2‚àí12‚Å¢Œ∑‚à•pk+1‚àíp¬Øk+1‚à•2]\displaystyle\Big{(}\frac{L^{\prime}}{2}+\frac{1}{2\eta}\Big{)}\lVert\overline% {p}^{k+1}-p^{k}\rVert^{2}-\frac{1}{2\eta}\lVert p^{k+1}-\overline{p}^{k+1}% \rVert^{2}\Big{]}( divide start_ARG italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_Œ∑ end_ARG ) ‚à• over¬Ø start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_Œ∑ end_ARG ‚à• italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¬Ø start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ]

We now add inequalities (30) and (31) to obtain:

ùîº[œÜ(pk+1)]‚â§ùîº[\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\Big{[}\varphi(p^{k+1})\Big{]}\leq\mathbb{E}\Big{[}blackboard_E [ italic_œÜ ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] ‚â§ blackboard_E [ œÜ‚Å¢(pk)+(L‚Ä≤2‚àí12‚Å¢Œ∑)‚Å¢‚à•pk+1‚àípk‚à•2+ùúësuperscriptùëùùëòlimit-fromsuperscriptùêø‚Ä≤212ùúÇsuperscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•superscriptùëùùëò1superscriptùëùùëò2\displaystyle\varphi(p^{k})+\Big{(}\frac{L^{\prime}}{2}-\frac{1}{2\eta}\Big{)}% \lVert p^{k+1}-p^{k}\rVert^{2}+italic_œÜ ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + ( divide start_ARG italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_Œ∑ end_ARG ) ‚à• italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT +

We now focus on the term T1subscriptùëá1T_{1}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Using Cauchy-Schwartz relation and the fact that the geometric mean of two non-negative real numbers is always less than its arithmetic mean, we obtain the following: T1‚â§‚à•pk+1‚àíp¬Øk+1‚à•‚Å¢‚à•Œ¶‚Å¢(pk,h‚Å¢(pk,d))‚àíŒ∂k‚Å¢Œ¶^k‚à•‚â§12‚Å¢Œ∑‚Å¢‚à•pk+1‚àíp¬Øk+1‚à•2+Œ∑2‚Å¢‚à•Œ¶‚Å¢(pk,h‚Å¢(pk,d))‚àíŒ∂k‚Å¢Œ¶^k‚à•2.subscriptùëá1delimited-‚à•‚à•superscriptùëùùëò1superscript¬Øùëùùëò1delimited-‚à•‚à•Œ¶superscriptùëùùëò‚ÑésuperscriptùëùùëòùëësuperscriptùúÅùëòsuperscript^Œ¶ùëò12ùúÇsuperscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•superscriptùëùùëò1superscript¬Øùëùùëò12ùúÇ2superscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•Œ¶superscriptùëùùëò‚ÑésuperscriptùëùùëòùëësuperscriptùúÅùëòsuperscript^Œ¶ùëò2T_{1}\leq\lVert p^{k+1}-\overline{p}^{k+1}\rVert\ \lVert\Phi(p^{k},h(p^{k},d))% -\zeta^{k}\hat{\Phi}^{k}\rVert\leq\frac{1}{2\eta}\lVert p^{k+1}-\overline{p}^{% k+1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{\eta}{2}\lVert\Phi(p^{k},h(p^{k},d))-\zeta^{k}\hat{\Phi}^% {k}\rVert^{2}.italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ ‚à• italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - Using the above inequality in (32), we obtain:

ùîº[œÜ(pk+1)]‚â§ùîº[œÜ(pk)+(L‚Ä≤2‚àí12‚Å¢Œ∑)‚Å¢‚à•pk+1‚àípk‚à•2‚èüT2+\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\Big{[}\varphi(p^{k+1})\Big{]}\leq\mathbb{E}\Big{[}% \varphi(p^{k})+\underset{T_{2}}{\underbrace{\Big{(}\frac{L^{\prime}}{2}-\frac{% 1}{2\eta}\Big{)}\lVert p^{k+1}-p^{k}\rVert^{2}}}+blackboard_E [ italic_œÜ ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] ‚â§ blackboard_E [ italic_œÜ ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + start_UNDERACCENT italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG under‚èü start_ARG ( divide start_ARG italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_Œ∑ end_ARG ) ‚à• italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG end_ARG + (33)
Œ∑2‚à•Œ¶(pk,h(pk,d))‚àíŒ∂kŒ¶^k‚à•2+(L‚Ä≤‚àí12‚Å¢Œ∑)Œ∑2‚à•ùí¢(pk)‚à•2].\displaystyle\frac{\eta}{2}{{\lVert\Phi(p^{k},h(p^{k},d))-\zeta^{k}\hat{\Phi}^% {k}\rVert^{2}}}+\Big{(}{L^{\prime}}-\frac{1}{2\eta}\Big{)}\eta^{2}\lVert% \mathcal{G}(p^{k})\rVert^{2}\Big{]}.divide start_ARG italic_Œ∑ end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ‚à• roman_Œ¶ ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_h ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_d ) ) - italic_Œ∂ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT over^ start_ARG roman_Œ¶ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + ( italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_Œ∑ end_ARG ) italic_Œ∑ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• caligraphic_G ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] .

ùîº‚Å¢[‚à•ùí¢‚Å¢(pk)‚à•2]ùîºdelimited-[]superscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•ùí¢superscriptùëùùëò2\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\Big{[}\lVert\mathcal{G}(p^{k})\rVert^{2}\Big{]}blackboard_E [ ‚à• caligraphic_G ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ‚â§2Œ∑‚Å¢(1‚àí2‚Å¢Œ∑‚Å¢L‚Ä≤){ùîº[œÜ(pk)]‚àíùîº[œÜ(pk+1)]+\displaystyle\leq\frac{2}{\eta(1-2\eta L^{\prime})}\Big{\{}\mathbb{E}\Big{[}% \varphi(p^{k})\Big{]}-\mathbb{E}\Big{[}\varphi(p^{k+1})\Big{]}+‚â§ divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_Œ∑ ( 1 - 2 italic_Œ∑ italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG { blackboard_E [ italic_œÜ ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] - blackboard_E [ italic_œÜ ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] +

(34)

We now analyze the term T3subscriptùëá3T_{3}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. ‚àá start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_œÜ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ctr end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ). Using the definitions of Œ¶‚Å¢(pk,h‚Å¢(pk,d)),Œ¶^kŒ¶superscriptùëùùëò‚Ñésuperscriptùëùùëòùëësuperscript^Œ¶ùëò\Phi(p^{k},h(p^{k},d)),\hat{\Phi}^{k}roman_Œ¶ ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_h ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_d ) ) , over^ start_ARG roman_Œ¶ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, we have:

T3=ùîº[\displaystyle T_{3}=\mathbb{E}\Big{[}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = blackboard_E [ ‚à•‚àápœÜctr‚àí‚àápœÜ^ctr+Hk‚ä§‚àáxœÜctr‚àíH^k‚ä§‚àáxœÜ^ctr+\displaystyle\lVert\nabla_{p}\varphi^{\rm ctr}-\nabla_{p}\hat{\varphi}^{\rm ctr% }+H^{k\top}\nabla_{x}\varphi^{\rm ctr}-\hat{H}^{k\top}\nabla_{x}\hat{\varphi}^% {\rm ctr}+‚à• ‚àá start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÜ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ctr end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - ‚àá start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_œÜ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ctr end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àá start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÜ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ctr end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over^ start_ARG italic_H end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àá start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_œÜ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ctr end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + (35)
Œ≥Hk‚ä§‚àáxœÜpol(h(pk,d))‚àíŒ≥H^k‚ä§‚àáxœÜpol(x^k+1)+wpekŒ∑‚à•2],\displaystyle\gamma H^{k\top}\nabla_{x}\varphi^{\rm pol}(h(p^{k},d))-\gamma% \hat{H}^{k\top}\nabla_{x}\varphi^{\rm pol}(\hat{x}^{k+1})+\frac{w_{\rm pe}^{k}% }{\eta}\rVert^{2}\Big{]},italic_Œ≥ italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àá start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÜ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_pol end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_h ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_d ) ) - italic_Œ≥ over^ start_ARG italic_H end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àá start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÜ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_pol end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + divide start_ARG italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_pe end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_Œ∑ end_ARG ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ,

where Hk=‚àáph‚Å¢(pk,d)superscriptùêªùëòsubscript‚àáùëù‚ÑésuperscriptùëùùëòùëëH^{k}=\nabla_{p}h(p^{k},d)italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = ‚àá start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_d ) is the true sensitivity and H^ksuperscript^ùêªùëò\hat{H}^{k}over^ start_ARG italic_H end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is its estimate at time kùëòkitalic_k. We now analyze the upper-bound on T3subscriptùëá3T_{3}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT:

T3‚â§(a)6{\displaystyle T_{3}\overset{(a)}{\leq}6\Big{\{}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_OVERACCENT ( italic_a ) end_OVERACCENT start_ARG ‚â§ end_ARG 6 { ‚à•‚àápœÜctr‚àí‚àápœÜ^ctr‚à•2+‚à•(Hk)‚ä§‚Å¢(‚àáxœÜctr‚àí‚àáxœÜ^ctr)‚à•2+superscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•subscript‚àáùëùsuperscriptùúëctrsubscript‚àáùëùsuperscript^ùúëctr2limit-fromsuperscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•superscriptsuperscriptùêªùëòtopsubscript‚àáùë•superscriptùúëctrsubscript‚àáùë•superscript^ùúëctr2\displaystyle\lVert\nabla_{p}\varphi^{\rm ctr}-\nabla_{p}\hat{\varphi}^{\rm ctr% }\rVert^{2}+\lVert(H^{k})^{\top}(\nabla_{x}\varphi^{\rm ctr}-\nabla_{x}\hat{% \varphi}^{\rm ctr})\rVert^{2}+‚à• ‚àá start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÜ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ctr end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - ‚àá start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_œÜ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ctr end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + ‚à• ( italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ‚àá start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÜ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ctr end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - ‚àá start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_œÜ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ctr end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT +
œÉpe2Œ∑2+Œ≥2‚Å¢‚à•(Hk)‚ä§‚Å¢(‚àáxœÜpol‚Å¢(h‚Å¢(pk,d))‚àí‚àáxœÜpol‚Å¢(x^k+1))‚à•2+superscriptsubscriptùúépe2superscriptùúÇ2limit-fromsuperscriptùõæ2superscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•superscriptsuperscriptùêªùëòtopsubscript‚àáùë•superscriptùúëpol‚Ñésuperscriptùëùùëòùëësubscript‚àáùë•superscriptùúëpolsuperscript^ùë•ùëò12\displaystyle\frac{\sigma_{\rm pe}^{2}}{\eta^{2}}+\gamma^{2}\lVert(H^{k})^{% \top}(\nabla_{x}\varphi^{\rm pol}(h(p^{k},d))-\nabla_{x}{\varphi}^{\rm pol}(% \hat{x}^{k+1}))\rVert^{2}+divide start_ARG italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_pe end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_Œ∑ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG + italic_Œ≥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• ( italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ‚àá start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÜ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_pol end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_h ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_d ) ) - ‚àá start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÜ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_pol end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT +

‚â§(e)6{\displaystyle\overset{(e)}{\leq}6\Big{\{}start_OVERACCENT ( italic_e ) end_OVERACCENT start_ARG ‚â§ end_ARG 6 { 4‚Å¢n3/2‚Å¢œµg‚Å¢(Lp+L2‚Å¢Lx)+œÉpe2Œ∑2+4‚Å¢Œ≥2‚Å¢L2‚Å¢œµx2+4superscriptùëõ32subscriptitalic-œµùëîsubscriptùêøùëùsuperscriptùêø2subscriptùêøùë•superscriptsubscriptùúépe2superscriptùúÇ2limit-from4superscriptùõæ2superscriptùêø2superscriptsubscriptitalic-œµùë•2\displaystyle 4n^{3/2}\epsilon_{g}(L_{p}+L^{2}L_{x})+\frac{\sigma_{\rm pe}^{2}% }{\eta^{2}}+4\gamma^{2}L^{2}\epsilon_{x}^{2}+4 italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 3 / 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œµ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_g end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + divide start_ARG italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_pe end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_Œ∑ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG + 4 italic_Œ≥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œµ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT +
(4nŒ≥2+‚à•‚àáxœÜ^ctr¬±‚àáxœÜctr‚à•2)ùîº[‚à•ek‚à•2]}\displaystyle\big{(}4n\gamma^{2}+\lVert\nabla_{x}\hat{\varphi}^{\rm ctr}\pm% \nabla_{x}{\varphi}^{\rm ctr}\rVert^{2}\big{)}\mathbb{E}\Big{[}\lVert e^{k}% \rVert^{2}\Big{]}\Big{\}}( 4 italic_n italic_Œ≥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + ‚à• ‚àá start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_œÜ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ctr end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ¬± ‚àá start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÜ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ctr end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) blackboard_E [ ‚à• italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] }
‚â§(f)6{\displaystyle\overset{(f)}{\leq}6\Big{\{}start_OVERACCENT ( italic_f ) end_OVERACCENT start_ARG ‚â§ end_ARG 6 { 4‚Å¢n3/2‚Å¢œµg‚Å¢(Lp+L2‚Å¢Lx)+œÉpe2Œ∑2+4‚Å¢Œ≥2‚Å¢L2‚Å¢œµx2+4superscriptùëõ32subscriptitalic-œµùëîsubscriptùêøùëùsuperscriptùêø2subscriptùêøùë•superscriptsubscriptùúépe2superscriptùúÇ2limit-from4superscriptùõæ2superscriptùêø2superscriptsubscriptitalic-œµùë•2\displaystyle 4n^{3/2}\epsilon_{g}(L_{p}+L^{2}L_{x})+\frac{\sigma_{\rm pe}^{2}% }{\eta^{2}}+4\gamma^{2}L^{2}\epsilon_{x}^{2}+4 italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 3 / 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œµ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_g end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + divide start_ARG italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_pe end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_Œ∑ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG + 4 italic_Œ≥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œµ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT +

To obtain (a)ùëé(a)( italic_a ), we added and subtracted (Hk)‚ä§‚Å¢‚àáxœÜ^ctrsuperscriptsuperscriptùêªùëòtopsubscript‚àáùë•superscript^ùúëctr(H^{k})^{\top}\nabla_{x}\hat{\varphi}^{\rm ctr}( italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àá start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_œÜ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ctr end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and Œ≥‚Å¢(Hk)‚ä§‚Å¢‚àáxœÜpol‚Å¢(x^k+1)ùõæsuperscriptsuperscriptùêªùëòtopsubscript‚àáùë•superscriptùúëpolsuperscript^ùë•ùëò1\gamma(H^{k})^{\top}\nabla_{x}\varphi^{\rm pol}(\hat{x}^{k+1})italic_Œ≥ ( italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ä§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àá start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÜ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_pol end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) inside the norm in (35).
