Further, we use inequality ‚à•Hk‚àíH^k‚à•‚â§‚à•Hk‚àíH^k‚à•F=‚à•ek‚à•delimited-‚à•‚à•superscriptùêªùëòsuperscript^ùêªùëòsubscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•superscriptùêªùëòsuperscript^ùêªùëòùêπdelimited-‚à•‚à•superscriptùëíùëò\lVert H^{k}-\hat{H}^{k}\rVert\leq\lVert H^{k}-\hat{H}^{k}\rVert_{F}=\lVert e^% {k}\rVert‚à• italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over^ start_ARG italic_H end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• ‚â§ ‚à• italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over^ start_ARG italic_H end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ‚à• italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à•, where ‚à•‚ãÖ‚à•Fsubscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•‚ãÖùêπ\lVert\cdot\rVert_{F}‚à• ‚ãÖ ‚à• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUBSCRIPT refers to the Frobenius norm and eksuperscriptùëíùëòe^{k}italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is the sensitivity estimation error. In (f)ùëì(f)( italic_f ), we made use of the fact that ‚à•a+b‚à•2‚â§2‚Å¢(‚à•a‚à•2+‚à•b‚à•2)superscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•ùëéùëè22superscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•ùëé2superscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•ùëè2\lVert a+b\rVert^{2}\leq 2(\lVert a\rVert^{2}+\lVert b\rVert^{2})‚à• italic_a + italic_b ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚â§ 2 ( ‚à• italic_a ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + ‚à• italic_b ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ). We then use Assumption 2 to state that ‚à•‚àáxœÜctr‚à•‚â§Mxdelimited-‚à•‚à•subscript‚àáùë•superscriptùúëctrsubscriptùëÄùë•\lVert\nabla_{x}\varphi^{\rm ctr}\rVert\leq M_{x}‚à• ‚àá start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÜ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ctr end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• ‚â§ italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and Lemma 3.6 to state the upper-bound on ‚à•‚àáxœÜctr‚àí‚àáxœÜ^ctr‚à•delimited-‚à•‚à•subscript‚àáùë•superscriptùúëctrsubscript‚àáùë•superscript^ùúëctr\lVert\nabla_{x}\varphi^{\rm ctr}-\nabla_{x}\hat{\varphi}^{\rm ctr}\rVert‚à• ‚àá start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÜ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ctr end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - ‚àá start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_œÜ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ctr end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à•.

We now use the inequality (36) in (34) and add the inequalities over the trigger time instances up to kùëòkitalic_k, leading to telescopic cancellation. Thus, we have:

‚àël‚ààùíØl‚â§kùîº[‚à•ùí¢(pl)‚à•2\displaystyle\sum_{\underset{l\leq k}{l\in\mathcal{T}}}\mathbb{E}[\lVert% \mathcal{G}(p^{l})\rVert^{2}‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_UNDERACCENT italic_l ‚â§ italic_k end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG italic_l ‚àà caligraphic_T end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_E [ ‚à• caligraphic_G ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ]‚â§2Œ∑‚Å¢(1‚àí2‚Å¢Œ∑‚Å¢L‚Ä≤){ùîº[œÜ(p0)]‚àíùîº[œÜ(pk+1)]}+\displaystyle]\leq\frac{2}{\eta(1-2\eta L^{\prime})}\Big{\{}\mathbb{E}\Big{[}% \varphi(p^{0})\Big{]}-\mathbb{E}\Big{[}\varphi(p^{k+1})\Big{]}\Big{\}}+] ‚â§ divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_Œ∑ ( 1 - 2 italic_Œ∑ italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG { blackboard_E [ italic_œÜ ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] - blackboard_E [ italic_œÜ ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] } +
6‚Å¢|ùíØ|1‚àí2‚Å¢Œ∑‚Å¢L‚Ä≤‚Å¢{4‚Å¢n3/2‚Å¢œµg‚Å¢(Lp+L2‚Å¢Lx)+œÉpe2Œ∑2+4‚Å¢Œ≥2‚Å¢L2‚Å¢œµx2}+limit-from6ùíØ12ùúÇsuperscriptùêø‚Ä≤4superscriptùëõ32subscriptitalic-œµùëîsubscriptùêøùëùsuperscriptùêø2subscriptùêøùë•superscriptsubscriptùúépe2superscriptùúÇ24superscriptùõæ2superscriptùêø2superscriptsubscriptitalic-œµùë•2\displaystyle\frac{6|\mathcal{T}|}{1-2\eta L^{\prime}}\Big{\{}4n^{3/2}\epsilon% _{g}(L_{p}+L^{2}L_{x})+\frac{\sigma_{\rm pe}^{2}}{\eta^{2}}+4\gamma^{2}L^{2}% \epsilon_{x}^{2}\Big{\}}+divide start_ARG 6 | caligraphic_T | end_ARG start_ARG 1 - 2 italic_Œ∑ italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG { 4 italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 3 / 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œµ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_g end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + divide start_ARG italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_pe end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_Œ∑ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG + 4 italic_Œ≥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œµ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT } +
12‚Å¢[2‚Å¢n‚Å¢Œ≥2+(Mx2+4‚Å¢n3/2‚Å¢œµg‚Å¢Lx)]1‚àí2‚Å¢Œ∑‚Å¢L‚Ä≤‚Å¢‚àël‚ààùíØl‚â§kùîº‚Å¢[‚à•el‚à•2].12delimited-[]2ùëõsuperscriptùõæ2superscriptsubscriptùëÄùë•24superscriptùëõ32subscriptitalic-œµùëîsubscriptùêøùë•12ùúÇsuperscriptùêø‚Ä≤subscriptùëôùëòùëôùíØùîºdelimited-[]superscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•superscriptùëíùëô2\displaystyle\frac{12\big{[}2n\gamma^{2}+(M_{x}^{2}+4n^{3/2}\epsilon_{g}L_{x})% \big{]}}{1-2\eta L^{\prime}}\sum_{\underset{l\leq k}{l\in\mathcal{T}}}\mathbb{% E}\Big{[}\lVert e^{l}\rVert^{2}\Big{]}.divide start_ARG 12 [ 2 italic_n italic_Œ≥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + ( italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + 4 italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 3 / 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œµ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_g end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] end_ARG start_ARG 1 - 2 italic_Œ∑ italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_UNDERACCENT italic_l ‚â§ italic_k end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG italic_l ‚àà caligraphic_T end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_E [ ‚à• italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] .

Since the positions do not change between two consecutive trigger time instances, it is sufficient to investigate convergence guarantees at the trigger time instances.

Using Theorem 3.8 for the upper-bound on ùîº‚Å¢[‚à•ek‚à•2]ùîºdelimited-[]superscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•superscriptùëíùëò2\mathbb{E}[\lVert e^{k}\rVert^{2}]blackboard_E [ ‚à• italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ], the summation of this term over the trigger instances leads to the following:

‚àël‚ààùíØl‚â§kùîº‚Å¢[‚à•el‚à•2]‚â§subscriptùëôùëòùëôùíØùîºdelimited-[]superscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•superscriptùëíùëô2absent\displaystyle\sum_{\underset{l\leq k}{l\in\mathcal{T}}}\mathbb{E}\Big{[}\lVert e% ^{l}\rVert^{2}\Big{]}\leq‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_UNDERACCENT italic_l ‚â§ italic_k end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG italic_l ‚àà caligraphic_T end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_E [ ‚à• italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ‚â§ |ùíØ|‚Å¢Cf+ùîº‚Å¢[‚à•e0‚à•2]‚Å¢‚àël‚ààùíØl‚â§k(c1‚Å¢Œæc2‚Å¢T)2‚Å¢|ùíØ|ùíØsubscriptùê∂ùëìùîºdelimited-[]superscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•superscriptùëí02subscriptùëôùëòùëôùíØsuperscriptsubscriptùëê1superscriptùúâsubscriptùëê2ùëá2ùíØ\displaystyle|\mathcal{T}|C_{f}+\mathbb{E}\Big{[}\lVert e^{0}\rVert^{2}\Big{]}% \sum_{\underset{l\leq k}{l\in\mathcal{T}}}(c_{1}\xi^{c_{2}T})^{2|\mathcal{T}|}| caligraphic_T | italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + blackboard_E [ ‚à• italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_UNDERACCENT italic_l ‚â§ italic_k end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG italic_l ‚àà caligraphic_T end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œæ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 | caligraphic_T | end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT (37)
|ùíØ|‚Å¢Cf+ùîº‚Å¢[‚à•e0‚à•2]‚Å¢(1‚àí(c1‚Å¢Œæc2‚Å¢T)2‚Å¢|ùíØ|1‚àí(c1‚Å¢Œæc2‚Å¢T)2).ùíØsubscriptùê∂ùëìùîºdelimited-[]superscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•superscriptùëí021superscriptsubscriptùëê1superscriptùúâsubscriptùëê2ùëá2ùíØ1superscriptsubscriptùëê1superscriptùúâsubscriptùëê2ùëá2\displaystyle|\mathcal{T}|C_{f}+\mathbb{E}\Big{[}\lVert e^{0}\rVert^{2}\Big{]}% \Big{(}\frac{1-(c_{1}\xi^{c_{2}T})^{2|\mathcal{T}|}}{1-(c_{1}\xi^{c_{2}T})^{2}% }\Big{)}.| caligraphic_T | italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + blackboard_E [ ‚à• italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ( divide start_ARG 1 - ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œæ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 | caligraphic_T | end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œæ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ) .

We start the algorithm with p0=0nsuperscriptùëù0subscript0ùëõp^{0}=0_{n}italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = 0 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, thus ùîº‚Å¢[œÜ‚Å¢(p0)]=œÜ‚Å¢(0)ùîºdelimited-[]ùúësuperscriptùëù0ùúë0\mathbb{E}\Big{[}\varphi(p^{0})\Big{]}=\varphi(0)blackboard_E [ italic_œÜ ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] = italic_œÜ ( 0 ). Further, ‚àÉœÜ‚àó‚â§ùîº‚Å¢[œÜ‚Å¢(pk)],‚àÄk‚àà‚Ñï0formulae-sequencesuperscriptùúëùîºdelimited-[]ùúësuperscriptùëùùëòfor-allùëòsubscript‚Ñï0\exists\ \varphi^{*}\leq\mathbb{E}\Big{[}\varphi(p^{k})\Big{]},\forall k\in% \mathbb{N}_{0}‚àÉ italic_œÜ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚â§ blackboard_E [ italic_œÜ ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] , ‚àÄ italic_k ‚àà blackboard_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, i.e. œÜ‚àósuperscriptùúë\varphi^{*}italic_œÜ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is a local optimal value. Thus, with the above formulations and (37), we obtain (19).

{tac}{IEEEbiography}

[]Sanjay Chandrasekaran recieved his B. Tech. degree in Instrumentation and Control and his MSc. degree in Information Technology and Electrical Engineering from the National Institute of Technology, Tiruchirappalli, India and ETH Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland in 2021 and 2023, respectively. His research interests lie in optimization-based control, learning-based control and network control systems.

{IEEEbiography}

[]Giulia De Pasquale (Member, IEEE) received the B.Sc. degree in Information Engineering, the M.Sc. degree in Control engineering and Ph.D. degree in Automatic Control in 2017, 2019, 2023, respectively, from the University of Padova, Padua, Italy. She is currently a post-doctoral researcher at the Automatic Control Laboratory, ETH Z√ºrich, Zurich, Switzerland. Her current research interests include modeling, analysis, and control of networked socio-technical systems.

{IEEEbiography}

[]Giuseppe Belgioioso (Member, IEEE) is an Assistant Professor at the Division of Decision and Control Systems at KTH Royal Institute of Technology, Sweden. He received the Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Information Engineering in 2012 and the Master‚Äôs degree (cum laude) in Control Systems in 2015, both at the University of Padova, Italy. In 2020, he obtained the Ph.D. degree in Automatic Control at Eindhoven University of Technology (TU/e), The Netherlands. From 2021 to 2024, he was first a Postdoctoral researcher and then Senior Scientist at the Automatic Control Laboratory at ETH Z√ºrich, Switzerland. His research lies at the intersection of optimization, game theory, and automatic control with applications in complex systems, such as electrical power grids and traffic networks.

{IEEEbiography}

[]Florian D√∂rfler (Senior Member, IEEE) received the Diploma in engineering cybernetics from the University of Stuttgart, Stuttgart, Germany, in 2008 and the Ph.D. degree in mechanical engineering from the University of California at Santa Barbara, CA, USA, in 2013. He is currently a Full Professor with the Automatic Control Laboratory, ETH Z√ºrich, Z√ºrich, Switzerland. His research interests include control, optimization, and system theory with applications in network systems, in particular electric power grids.
